Package mealplanner

Class Day

  • java.lang.Object
    • mealplanner.Day
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Day
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Day is an object corresponding the standard days of the week and has a ArrayList of Meals.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Meal> meals
      A list of meals tied to the day.
      private java.lang.String name
      The name of the Day.
      private static long serialVersionUID  
      private int totalCalories
      The sum total of the Calories in each meal in the day's meals.

        Constant Field Values

      • meals

        private java.util.ArrayList<Meal> meals
        A list of meals tied to the day.

      • totalCalories

        private int totalCalories
        The sum total of the Calories in each meal in the day's meals.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        The name of the Day. Only values used in the project are the days of the week. Eg. Sunday - Saturday

    • Constructor Detail

      • Day

        Day​(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor for Day. Initializes name to specified name. Meals is initialized to a default ArrayList. totalCalories are calculated using the getTotalCalories method.
        Parameters:
        name - String name of the day of the week.

    • Method Detail

      • getTotalCalories

        public int getTotalCalories()
        Calculates the total amount of Calories in a day by summing the calories of each meal in that day.
        Returns:
        Calorie total of the Day

        public java.util.ArrayList<Meal> getMeals()
        Getter for meals. Sorts based on Meal Type.
        Returns:
        Sorted Meal ArrayList

      • setMeals

        public void setMeals​(java.util.ArrayList<Meal> meals)

      • addMeal

        public boolean addMeal​(Meal m)
        Adds a meal to the Day's meals ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        m - meal to be added.
        Returns:
        True if successfully added, false if there was a problem.

      • removeMeal

        public boolean removeMeal​(Meal m)
        Removes a meal from the Day's meals ArrayList .
        Parameters:
        m - meal to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if removed, false if there was a problem.
